DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Speed
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Low [33]
        Medium [66]
        High [100]
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [100]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Speed [SSPD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Low [33]
          Medium [66]
          High [100]
    Set Direction [SDIR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Forward [0]
          Reverse [1]
    Turn On [DON]
    Turn Off [DOF]
    Query Status [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Can you set the living room fan to medium speed and reverse direction?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The fan speed can be set to Off, Low, Medium, or High, with Medium corresponding to 66. The direction can be Forward (0) or Reverse (1). The accepted commands to change these are Set Speed [SSPD] and Set Direction [SDIR], each requiring the appropriate enum parameter.

To fulfill the request, I will issue the Set Speed command with parameter Medium (66) and the Set Direction command with parameter Reverse (1).

Result: Execute SSPD with parameter 66 to set speed to Medium, and SDIR with parameter 1 to set direction to Reverse.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Kitchen Smart Oven
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 50 to 300 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Bake [1]
        Broil [2]
        Roast [3]
    Timer
      Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
    Status
      Enum
        Idle [0]
        Running [1]
        Paused [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 50 to 300 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SMOD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off [0]
          Bake [1]
          Broil [2]
          Roast [3]
    Set Timer [STMR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
    Start [DON]
    Pause [PAUS]
    Stop [DOF]
    Query Status [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
I want to roast at 220 degrees Celsius for 90 minutes. How do I set that up?

I analyze the device structure: the oven supports setting temperature between 50 and 300 °C, modes including Roast (3), and a timer from 0 to 180 minutes. Commands to set these are Set Temperature [STMP], Set Mode [SMOD], and Set Timer [STMR].

To roast at 220 °C for 90 minutes, I will first send SMOD with parameter 3 (Roast), then STMP with 220, and STMR with 90. Finally, the Start command [DON] should be issued to begin cooking.

Result: Execute SMOD(3) to set mode to Roast, STMP(220) to set temperature, STMR(90) to set timer, then DON to start the oven.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Bedroom Smart Window Blind
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open [DON]
    Close [DOF]
    Set Position [SPOS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Stop [STOP]
    Query Status [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Could you open the bedroom blinds halfway?

Reviewing the device structure, the blinds' position can be set from 0% (closed) to 100% (open). The accepted command to set position is Set Position [SPOS] with a parameter from 0 to 100 percent.

To open the blinds halfway, I will send the SPOS command with parameter 50.

Result: Execute SPOS(50) to open the bedroom blinds to 50%.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
        Opening [1]
        Closing [2]
    Lock
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [DON]
    Close Door [DOF]
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLK]
    Query Status [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Is the garage door locked and closed right now?

From the device structure, the garage door has two relevant properties: Status (Closed=0, Open=100, Opening=1, Closing=2) and Lock (Locked=0, Unlocked=1). To determine if the door is locked and closed, I need to check both properties.

If Status equals Closed (0) and Lock equals Locked (0), then the door is both locked and closed.

Result: Query the device status. If Status=0 and Lock=0, then the garage door is locked and closed; otherwise, it is not.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Outdoor Smart Sprinkler
  ***Properties***
    Water Flow
      Range 0 to 20 Unit liters_per_minute
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [100]
    Schedule
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Watering [DON]
    Stop Watering [DOF]
    Set Flow Rate [SFLW]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 20 Unit liters_per_minute
    Enable Schedule [ENSC]
    Disable Schedule [DSCS]
    Query Status [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Please start watering with a flow rate of 15 liters per minute and enable the schedule.

The device accepts commands to start watering (DON), stop watering (DOF), set flow rate (SFLW) with a parameter from 0 to 20 liters per minute, and enable or disable the schedule (ENSC, DSCS).

To fulfill the request, I will first set the flow rate to 15 liters per minute using SFLW(15), then start watering with DON, and finally enable the schedule with ENSC.

Result: Execute SFLW(15) to set flow rate, DON to start watering, and ENSC to enable the schedule.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Home Energy Meter
  ***Properties***
    Current Power
      Range 0 to 10000 Unit Watts
    Total Energy
      Range 0 to 100000 Unit kWh
    Status
      Enum
        Active [1]
        Inactive [0]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Reset Energy [RESET]
    Query Power [QPW]
    Query Energy [QEN]
USER QUERY:
How can I check the current power consumption and reset the total energy reading?

The device properties include Current Power (0-10000 Watts) and Total Energy (0-100000 kWh). To check current power, the accepted command is Query Power [QPW]. To reset the total energy reading, the command is Reset Energy [RESET].

Therefore, first send QPW to get the current power consumption, then send RESET to reset the total energy reading.

Result: Execute QPW to query current power, then RESET to reset total energy.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Bathroom Humidity Sensor
  ***Properties***
    Humidity
      Range 20 to 90 Unit %
    Status
      Enum
        Normal [0]
        High [1]
        Low [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Query Humidity [QHUM]
    Query Status [QSTS]
USER QUERY:
What is the current humidity level in the bathroom and is it considered high?

The device provides Humidity as a percentage between 20 and 90%, and a Status property indicating Normal (0), High (1), or Low (2). To get the current humidity, use Query Humidity [QHUM]. To check if it is high, use Query Status [QSTS].

First, query humidity with QHUM to get the numeric value. Then query status with QSTS to determine if the humidity is high.

Result: Execute QHUM to get humidity percentage, then QSTS to check if status is High (1). If status=1, humidity is high.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Refrigerator
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Saving Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Enable Power Saving [EPSV]
    Disable Power Saving [DPSV]
    Query Door Status [QDRS]
USER QUERY:
Can you lower the fridge temperature to 4 degrees Celsius and turn on power saving mode?

The refrigerator temperature can be set between 1 and 10 °C using Set Temperature [STMP]. Power Saving Mode can be enabled with Enable Power Saving [EPSV].

To fulfill the request, I will send STMP with parameter 4 to lower the temperature to 4 °C, then EPSV to enable power saving mode.

Result: Execute STMP(4) to set temperature, then EPSV to enable power saving mode.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:

Please set the water heater to 60 degrees Celsius and turn it on.

The water heater temperature can be set between 30 and 75 °C using Set Temperature [STMP]. To turn it on, use Turn On [DON].

I will first send STMP with parameter 60 to set the temperature, then send DON to turn the heater on.

Result: Execute STMP(60) to set temperature, then DON to turn on the water heater.
